refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns the name of a field from the statement

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: oci_field_name returns the name of the field corresponding to the field number (1-based).

example.title: oci_field_name example
example.programlisting: "; echo ""; echo "Name"; echo "Type"; echo "Length"; echo ""; $ncols = oci_num_fields($stmt); for ($i = 1; $i <= $ncols; $i++) { $column_name = oci_field_name($stmt, $i); $column_type = oci_field_type($stmt, $i); $column_size = oci_field_size($stmt, $i); echo ""; echo "$column_name"; echo "$column_type"; echo "$column_size"; echo ""; } echo "\n"; oci_free_statement($stmt); oci_close($conn); ?>

note.para: In PHP versions before 5.0.0 you must use ocicolumnname instead. This name still can be used, it was left as alias of oci_field_name for downwards compatability. This, however, is deprecated and not recommended.

refsect1.simpara: See also oci_num_fields, oci_field_type, and oci_field_size.
